column4: Hi, I have corrupted my xorg.conf file. I think it was created automatically when I installed. Can I create it again?
I can't boot any other way without errors
If they are X errors, just move to one of the virtual terminals ^^
Boot up, if the errors are about xorg, hit ctrl+alt+f1, login using your username and pass then run 'sudo dpkg-reconfigure xorg-server'
